org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.util

Class T_ConsistencyChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.util.T_ConsistencyChecker

  • public class T_ConsistencyChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has methods for corrupting a database. IT MUST NOT BE DISTRIBUTED WITH THE PRODUCT. NOTE: The entry points to this class are all static, for easy access via the query language. Each of the static methods instantiates an object from the class and calls methods off of that object. This allows the sharing of code across the various static methods.

      • runConsistencyChecker

        public static java.lang.String runConsistencyChecker()
                                              throws org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException,
                                                     java.sql.SQLException
        Run all of the consistency checkers which do not take parameters. Actually, just run the ones that "make sense" to run. Today, that is: countOpens()
        Returns:
        String If an inconsistency is found, and if DEBUG is on, then a string will be returned with more info. If DEBUG is off, then a simple string will be returned stating whether or not there are open scans.
        Throws:
        org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException - Thrown on error
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown on error

      • countOpens

        public static java.lang.String countOpens()
                                   throws org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException
        Check to make sure that there are no open conglomerates, scans or sorts.
        Returns:
        String If an inconsistency is found, and if DEBUG is on, then a string will be returned with more info. If DEBUG is off, then a simple string will be returned stating whether or not there are open scans.
        Throws:
        org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException - Thrown on error

      • countDependencies

        public static java.lang.String countDependencies()
                                          throws org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException,
                                                 java.sql.SQLException
        Check to make sure that there are no active dependencies (stored or in memory).
        Returns:
        String If an inconsistency is found, and if DEBUG is on, then a string will be returned with more info. If DEBUG is off, then a simple string will be returned stating whether or not there are open scans.
        Throws:
        org.apache.derby.iapi.error.StandardException - Thrown on error
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown on error

        private static org.apache.derby.iapi.services.context.Context getContext(java.lang.String contextID)
        Privileged lookup of a Context. Must be private so that user code can't call this entry point.
